Tutorial.name: Tutorial
Tutorial.FlavourText:
Welcome! Be introduced to the world of Weyard and Golden Sun!
React with <:Fight:536919792813211648> to join a battle.
Then, press <:Battle:536954571256365096> when you are ready to start the Tutorial!

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome to the marvelous world of Weyard, aspiring Adept. I will introduce you to the setting of Golden Sun and how the mechanics are going to work. If you want to take your time while doing this, you can react with :pause_button: to stop a battle from automatically going forward. To continue, use 'Attack'.

Weyard is a world filled with the power of Alchemy. This means that everything consists of the four classical elements.
Venus, the element of Earth,
Mars, the element of Fire,
Jupiter, the element of Wind, and
Mercury, the element of Water.
An Adept is a human who inherited the power of one of these elements.

As you are an aspiring Adept too, you will want to align yourself with one of these elements, if you haven't done so yet. You can do so by using the `/element <e.g. Venus>`, using the `/class` command or by going to #some-channel. Don't worry, this choice isn't final. You can change it any time you want.

You will see that you have been put into a class. This class determines the your stats and the abilities (the Psynergy) you have access to. Furthermore, any given class is either a Warrior or a Mage, which determines the type of equipment you can wield. Changing your class is just as easy, you can do it using the `/class` command and see all your available classes with `i!classes`.

Speaking of equipment. Here is some basic gear that you can equip for starters. Go to your `/inv` and select one of your archtype gear sets. There you can equip your items. You will also see a button to open your chests along the way.

At last, let's talk about battles. Bringing a fighter's HP to zero knocks them out. You can use a variety of different Psynergy, including attacks that either target a single enemy or area-of-effect moves, healing moves, or status moves. Watch how using Psynergy takes up Psynergy Points (PP), the equivalent of mana. Make sure to have enough to spare to get out of a pinch! Now, try to take down this opponent.

If there are multiple enemies, you need to select your target. First choose the move you want to use, and then an enemy from the select menu. In the case of area-of-effect attacks, the selected enemy is the centermost enemy which will take most of the damage.

At points during your journey, you may face longer pieces of text or puzzles. If you want to read these carefully, react with :pause_button: in the channel. This will pause the turn until you're ready. You can find :pause_button: in the default Discord emotes. If you don't use :pause_button:, a move will be chosen for you after about 30 seconds, and the next round will begin. Here is a puzzle, then: What is the world of Golden Sun called?

Well done! You are set and ready! You are starting off in the calm town of Vault. It is near the Ruins of Vale, one of the most significant locations to the world of Golden Sun and the perfect place to start an unforgettable adventure! To visit one of these places, use `i!dungeon Vale` (or Vault, respectively)

RewardTables.message:
**Quick summary**:
-Use commands in #gabomba-gears.
View your status with `/status`. This is a hub that leads you to all aspects of the game
-Select an element and class using `/element` and `/class`. You can change it at any time.
-Pause a battle by reacting anywhere with :pause_button:. The timer will restart at the beginning of the next turn.
-view your inventory with `/inv`, where you can equip gear and open chests!
-Visit your newly discovered places with`/dungeons` or go there directly with `i!dungeon Vale` (or Vault)

Don't be shy to ask questions in #colosso-talks or find team mates to brawl with! A lot of information is also pinned!

Vale.name: Vale
Vale.FlavourText: The site of the once calm town of Vale. It was destroyed and then abandoned when the Golden Sun rose, but the ruins are steeped in history.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You arrive in the mountainous area that once housed Vale, and begin making your way up the slopes past abandoned houses, smashed pathways, and shattered stairs. Among these ruins, Valeans trained hard to protect their village and secrets. As a young adept, you are walking in their footsteps.
As you finish climbing the first slope, a light storm rises. You find the town was only abandoned by people... the critters have taken over.
The storm gets harsher and the wind and rain pick up. More critters attack!
The noise of your battles has attracted attention. Out of one of the ruined houses, a swarm of bats gets stirred up.
You pause to rest after those fights. Did you eat something funny? Why are the mushrooms walking!?
You reach the river and begin to try making your way across. Watch out! A boulder is falling from Mount Aleph! You need to dodge it!
EnemyNames: Boulder|KilledBy:Player@-5|Runner:0:The boulder loudly crashed into the river

RewardTables.message: The boulder cracks open, revealing some treasure.

Matchups.Flavourtext: The storm starts to subside, but a few critters are still roaming around.
You reach the highest part of Vale and make camp for the night. Like the Valean Adepts of old, you will set out tomorrow to explore Weyard. Adventures, monsters, and treasures await you!

Sol Sanctum.name: Sol Sanctum
Sol Sanctum.FlavourText: The destroyed holy grounds above Vale. The Sanctum still stands, though its corridors have fallen into disrepair and are infested with monsters.

Matchups.Flavourtext: The broken down entrance of the Sanctuary is still impressively massive and massively impressive. You enter cautiously...
As the way lights up, some monsters get scared and jump forward!
You solve some puzzles to free the way to empty rooms. Well, not *completely* empty, anyways.
You reach a very distinct room. You have heard about it. You see a bunch of statues, but you can only move one to disarm the famous trap. Which one will it be?

You step through the revealed door. You have reached the ruined Star Chamber! The roof of it has broken down and the room is exposed directly to the Golden Sun. Some nasty looking monsters are looking at you from afar, it would be better to turn back now than never!

On the ledge of the star chambers platform, high above the watery depths, you spot a person sitting there with crossed legs. Startled by the commotion, the person stands up and slowly walks towards you. 
'Welcome', the purple haired woman said calmly. 'My name is Hama. I like to come here amidst the spirits to meditate. I assume you also came here to learn more about the mysteries of Alchemy. Perhaps it's your luck, perhaps it is destiny that our paths have crossed. Let me be your guide in showing you the world!'

Star Chamber.name: Star Chamber
Star Chamber.FlavourText: The mysterious star chamber, in the depths of the Sol Sanctum. Watch out, it's slippery!

Matchups.Flavourtext: You trace your path back to the Star Chamber in Sol Sanctum, and step through the door. Some colorful glowing lights assault you! What's going on? The Star Chamber appears to be alive! Watch out!
That was close. You step further into the chamber, and the guardians of the elemental stars notice you.
This was supposed to be a peaceful place, what's happening? The creatures living in the water are climbing up to you.
You see more djinn in the distance. They're approaching you! Wait a minute, those aren't djinn, they're more of those balls!

From what appears to be water down below, a silhouette can me made out. 'I am the guardian of water. Well, his apprentice. And you have been busting my balls all day, so I'm slowly starting to get fed up'

RewardTables.message: Nice work, {0}! You beat the first optional side dungeon! Keep your eyes open for others!

Matchups.Flavourtext: With that battle finished, the Star Chamber begins to quiet down into its customary silence. Well done! You defeated the secret mini super boss!

Vale Cave.name: Vale Cave
Vale Cave.FlavourText: Hidden behind Kraden's Cottage, there is a small cave. Whatever might be in there?

Matchups.Flavourtext: You walk in, and... a bear is in the cave. What did you expect?
You wipe off the hair, and are immediately ambushed by some hungry monsters. Let's go!
The cave is getting darker and danker.. What will be at the end of it?
'*We need to go deeper*' a voice inside of you whispers, full of curiosity. Another voice tells you that it's probably not worth it.
The cave is getting spooky. You can see a yellow stone glimmering in the back. The voices inside you argue cacophonously about whether you should keep going.
Oh hey! A Jupiter Djinni flies down from above.
Looks like it was worth it after all! Now let's quickly exit this creepy place...

Vault.name: Vault
Vault.FlavourText: Vault is a small town in the center of Angara. It has become the refuge for a lot of Valeans.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Since the events of the Golden Sun, a lot of Valeans moved to Vault. The amount of monsters around here is making a lot of them reconsider. A guy named Patcher has been talking about setting up shop nearby, but the location seems to be slightly infested...
As you move on, the locals tell you the cemetery is unsettling a lot of the inhabitants. You can see why!
The skeleton's bones clatter to the ground. The commotion has attracted a dog... and wolves! Protect the pup!
The dog is thankful for saving him and giving him a bone. He barks at you, wagging his tail, and appears to want to show you something, but you are distracted by some rats.
You head to the inn, book a room and take a quick nap. You wake up as a bunch of thieves are rummaging through your stuff, you need to stop them!
Wow, what a dangerous neighborhood. No wonder the Valeans aren't happy here either. Let's sleep for one more night and then get out of here!

Vault Cave.name: Vault Cave
Vault Cave.FlavourText: From the top of the watchtower in Vault, you see a Djinni! It looks like it's in a tree. Maybe ringing the town bell will scare it?

Matchups.Flavourtext: Trying to find a way to reach the Djinni, you go back to Vault's cemetary and notice a strange pattern in the tombstones. You see the dog you saved from the wolves looking at you expectantly. What should you do?

*'A careful search will reveal a passage leading underground nearby,'* the dog informs you. Bingo, you look more carefully and find an entrance! The rumors about the cemetary you heard when you were in Vault before were correct after all.
You step into the cave. That's a nice chest, I wonder what it's doing so close to the entrance?
You feel hungry after that fight. Hey, time for a mushroom salad with honey before going further! ... wait, those are Death Caps!
You move further down the cave. What a large fellow, maybe he'll want to... oh nevermind it's a Cave Troll.
You enter a large room. What incredible statues! I wonder what would happen if I boop them on the snoot...
You pass through a corridor and round a corner. Oh no, an adept must have died and became a ghost... Let's put this mage to rest.
You find some stairs leading up, instead of down! This must be the right way. At the top, you find... I didn't think bears came in green. The more you know...
Another corridor leads you to a rotting, yet mobile corpse. What is with all of these dead people in caves? How many people could have died in a hidden cave beneath a seemingly peaceful town?
The smell of fresh air beckons, and you push through into sunlight! Finally the outdoors. Hey is that the Djinni from earlier? Let's get him!
Well _this_ was interesting! And now you get to turn around and go aaaall the way back...

Goma Cave.name: Goma Cave
Goma Cave.FlavourText: A cave through the Goma mountain range. A river runs through it. Though dark, it leads to Bilibin, and perhaps contains other surprises...

Matchups.Flavourtext: You step into the cave and are immediately confronted by... Is this the lost head of Dullahan?
You move on, and suddenly... Bats?! In a cave?! No way! And you don't have Repels...
As you advance further in the murk, you hear the sound of sinister lamenting.
Having put the goblins to rest, you almost immediately trip over undead. Is there anything left that's alive in this cave?
The way out is near. But before enjoying the sun again, you encounter a Djinni!
Next time you visit a cave, you resolve to bring some repels.

Bilibin.name: Bilibin
Bilibin.FlavourText: Bilibin, ruled by Lord McCoy, is a medium sized town situated just north of the Goma mountain range. Travelers headed to Imil stop here before turning north on their trek. There are also rumors of an underground passage holding the lord's treasures.

Matchups.Flavourtext: A few critters on the way to Bilibin.

Bilibin is a small town in the middle of Angara, just east of the Goma Range. At the town gate you see a tree trunk carved beautifully into the shape of a man. A sign in front tells the story of people being turned into trees. Weirdos.

In the middle of the town square, a golden statue dominates the small market. Lord McCoy, the Mayor who was passing by, shouts: 'Noice day, isnae it laddie? What yeh see is a statue of my wife'. What a cult of personality...

RewardTables.message: Oi, laddie! Yeh, you, Adept, or whatever you might be. I have a task for ye. Some time ago me men cut down some trees. It mad the ole tree, Tret, mad and turned me men into wood themselves! Ever since we didnae touch a single branch of the ole spud, but now he accuses me men to clear too much woodland again! It wasnae me men, I swear! So go tae the ole bloke and tell him that it wasnae us who did it. None of me men can walk intae the woods and return. What areya standing there rooted to the ground fer? Go!
It wae a spirit, you say? Ye, yer kin an yer magic stuff, only bringing trouble all the time! Get lost before we burst up in flames or the ground unde yae feet rips open. Be gone, I said!

Matchups.Flavourtext: What's that? A small gap between the statue and the ground reveals a little cave. Too bad, it doesn't lead anywhere except to a shelter for some shady people.

You explore more of the town. After some parkouring through the town you find another entrance to the Mayor's Warehouse cave. From here you can use your Psynergy to free the way. Which one do you use?
This is what Lord McCoy was hiding here... a Jupiter Djinni!
Onto the next shenanigans, before the guards figure out that you found the hideout.

Bilibin Cave.name: Bilibin Cave
Bilibin Cave.FlavourText: A small cave through the mountains north of Bilibin. Though twisty and dangerous, it provides passage for travelers headed for Imil, the frozen town near Mercury Lighthouse.

Matchups.Flavourtext: There is a small entrance to a cave. As you approach, you scare up some animals.
You enter the cave and quickly find yourself in a dead end. There seems to be a small ledge up there with a chest. If you jump high enough, you *might* reach it. Watch out, it's a bit gooey.
You hear an annoyed growl. It's a bear! In a cave... what did you expect?
You notice with the steam of your breath how the cave keeps getting colder and colder. What's up with that, huh?

You start to see how the cave freezes over, except for the spots with torches. Truly shows the balance of nature... A Mercury Adept could surely use this place to get these powers under their control.
At last you see a bright light, marking the end of this cold cave. Oh wait! It *keeps* getting colder! And now you're being attacked by a pack of Wolfkins. Great.
Finally you see a light... and snow.

Imil.name: Imil
Imil.FlavourText: Imil, the frozen town at the northernmost part of Angara. It's said that the Mercury Clan lived here in times past, and tended to both this town and the nearby Mercury Lighthouse.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Approaching Imil, a gang of critters led by a gnome try to mug you...
You found a snowman at the entrance. When you approached, a monster attacked you from inside of it!
Once in the town, some townspeople tell you that there are issues with wild animals. Kind as you are, you gladly volunteer to help.

RewardTables.message: The villagers tell you how the light of the Mercury Lighthouse seems to weirdly flicker and how a white, ghostly apparition is seen at these times. They are too scared to check it out themselves, and they'd greatly reward you if you made sure that things are right.

Thank you for saving the lighthouse! So a spirit was draining the power of the lighthouse! And that Saturos... We heard he was dead? How come he was on top of the lighthouse? How scary... I hope you Adepts can protect us!'

Matchups.Flavourtext: That business taken care of, the people tell you of the epidemics they used to suffer from before the lighthouse was lit, pointing towards the bright blue light to the north.

Most of the town is out ice skating. Wanting to join in, you venture out onto the frozen river. Two little kids, calling themselves Justin and Megan ask you if you know a person called Mia. 'She is our hero!', they claim.

Not knowing this Mia and not wanting to upset them, you skate off. But then you slip and crash into the frozen waterfall! There is a warm cave behind it, where a Mars Djinni is keeping two bears comfortable as they hibernate.
The town is friendly, but bitingly cold. Time to get out of here!

Mercury Lighthouse.name: Mercury Lighthouse
Mercury Lighthouse.FlavourText: The mystical Mercury Lighthouse, home to the power of water.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You reach the Mercury Lighthouse, and you notice the fountain of Hermes Water. Having heard about it's ability to heal those even on the brink of death, you decide to scoop some in a bottle on your way in for safe keeping. As you make your way in the entrance of the lighthouse, you are immediately accosted by a large humanoid lizard, adamant about blocking your way. You are provided with no option other than felling the reptile.
After besting the Lizard Man and delving further into the Lighthouse, it becomes clear that the place has been taken over by monsters. They don't seem too thrilled by your presence, either.

Navigating through halls and waterfalls, you find a chest, sitting right out in the open. The prospect of easy loot sounds absolutely lovely, but you also are suspicious of the chest. You must make a choice: Open it, or leave it?
Moving onward, you reach a large and magnificent statue, but some monsters seem to have beaten you here.
The statue blesses you with the gift to traverse across the water's surface. I think those bears may be jealous...
More lizard men turn the corner. Best to do away with them now, before they learn about their fallen comrade at the entrance.
These monsters are still insistent on ruining your sightseeing in the Lighthouse...
Some beasts in chains have you in their sights. Fortunately for you, they entered your sights first.
You check behind a waterfall, as you have the others you've passed. Behind this one happens to be a disgruntled Mercury Djinni.
More bears... anyone want a bearskin rug?
You come to one final waterfall, and with some prayers you reverse the flow of the water to carry you to the lighthouse aerie. Seems you have a farewell party as well.

Upon reaching the Aerie, you find the lighthouse beacon already lit, and none other than Saturos himself waiting. He seems to want to challenge your strength, and he likely won't take no for an answer. You drink your bottle of Hermes Water and prepare for the battle...

RewardTables.message: A girl approaches you, she watched you battle the monster and you think you saw her back in the depths of Kolima. 'Oh young Adept! You have shown remarkable strength! I will let the guard allow you to pass over the draw bridge after Kolima. I'm in a hurry, are you on your way to Lama Temple? Let us meet there! Oh, sorry, I forgot to mention. My Name is Feizhi! Nice to meet you, bye!'

You successfully defeated Saturos, but instead of the warrior going to the ground, he appears well and healthy. Without a word the Proxian turns on the spot and swiftly runs to one of the side towers, almost floating. You feel an ice cold breeze blowing towards the side tower, the light of the lighthouse begins to flicker. A huge, white beast appears, with long fur and shaped like a gigantic dog with one giant horn on in the middle of its head. In one continuous breath the creature is sucking in the air, the snow and the psynergy radiating from the lighthouse. Saturos clearly tries to attack the beast, but comes too late. The monster floats away and dissappears in the distance, near the shore of the icy sea. You try to remember the spot, this must be one of the spirits Hama was talking about!

Matchups.Flavourtext: Saturos? But that couldn't be. You heard the legends and he fell when fighting the Warriors of Vale. He was a misunderstood hero! Strange...

Lunpa.name: Lunpa
Lunpa.FlavourText: Lunpa, home of Dodonpa's renowned family of thieves. It's supposed to be a fortress, but a big sign out front says, 'Welcome to Lunpa! The strongest warriors may enter! Children and spectators, please talk to the guards!'

Matchups.Flavourtext: 'Welcome to Lunpa, home of the great Dodonpa,' a bored-sounding town crier intones. 'Run the gauntlet, prove your strength and stealth, do battle with the Mighty Toadonpa, and win a mystery prize. Tickets are 500 coins.' He gets a closer look at you and your equipment, and pauses. Lowering his voice, he whispers to you, 'Actually, you look halfway competent and the guards are getting really bored.' He hands you a ticket and gestures you towards the fortress gates. 'Just, please give them a decent fight, and don't tell Lord Dodonpa.'

You hand your ticket in at the fortress gates. They tell you to 'fearlessly meet the Fortress Challenges, find the key, and fight the monster,' and wave you in. Before you can get very far, you're accosted by some sneaky monsters.

A guard is pacing slowly down the hall. He announces loudly every 15 feet or so, 'I sure hope I don't find any INTRUDERS in the fortress, or they'll lose the challenge and I'll have to escort them out.' Quick, hide in the shadows and wait 'til he goes away?
A group of fortress guards are talking amongst themselves here. As you walk up, they straighten up and ready their weapons. 'A challenger! About time,' they say.

Having thrashed the guards soundly, they nod and let you pass. One of them whispers, 'Dodonpa's favorite color' to you as you move by. The fortress contains dozens of rooms, which you methodically search through. One of them contains a Mercury Djinni relaxing on a barstool in front of a counter. Annoyed, it attacks!
You keep going deeper into the stronghold. Seems like it's the right way, because you bump into another group of guards! They grin and draw their weapons.
Another side room holds a table with three keys. Just up the passage you hear another bored-sounding guard announcing that if he spots you, you lose the challenge, so choose wisely!
Finally, you enter a wide, arena-like room and spot a yellow door with a sign that reads 'Winner's Exit.' But as soon as you do, a huge toad-like monster also spots you. It bellows and attacks!
Having defeated the monster, you collect your 'mystery item' and proceed through the exit. The town crier nods to you as you leave the city. What a weird place.

Kolima.name: Kolima
Kolima.FlavourText: Trees, trees and more trees. Quite the treey scenery. You wood not want to get lost here.

Matchups.Flavourtext: As you walk north along the coast of Angara, you are certain to pass this town. But before you get there... what's this, the Queen of Rats or what?
In the distance you see some trees, but as you approach you realize that it's a town. You walk in, and it's surpringly calm and a bit overgrown. The perfect place for a Venus Djinni!
The town was too quiet to hold your interest, so you head back out. Further north, you spot a forest you want to check out.
Some bees swarming around decide to attack you. Pretty typical in this kind of place.
Woops, something between the trees is moving. Totally normal! After all, you've been rolling around logs all day.
You continue to advance deeper and deeper into the forest, taking care that you don't get lost. Unlike these guys, who were eaten by a troll.
Dusk is setting in. Either you find the way out now or try to survive the night.
The woods are getting clearer. You've made it out safely! You return to Kolima's inn for the night.

Tret Tree.name: Tret Tree
Tret Tree.FlavourText: The thick forest around the sentient elder tree, Tret. He seems to be sleeping and his branches are thronged with wild creatures. Dare you wake him?

Matchups.Flavourtext: Rodents of unusual size! A respectable first fight, yet you sigh upon recalling the great size of Tret.

First there was the forest, now there's this tree maze, too, and a few forest denizens bar your way. It feels like there's eyes assessing your abilities from somewhere in the branches. A trained Venus adept might be able to use a localized earthquake to shake the observer from their perch...
You pick your way through the maze. As you round a corner, you're ambushed! Since they were born, they've been stayin' alive.
After searching around a while, you find a room with a table of spiders playing cards. They immediately notice you, uh oh...
After cleaning webs off yourself, you take the first exit you see, which surprisingly leads to a Jupiter Djinni! However, he's in a bad mood so he wants to battle.
You return to the third floor and notice some shadows in the corner. What is it? CREEPER! Aw man...
As you are about to check the chest, a troll enters the room.
As you are about to check the chest AGAIN, more trolls enter the room. Someone likes to troll you.

You have had enough of this tree. You want to end this, so you jump down the middle of the tree. To your surprise, you found what you were looking for: Tret, asleep. He grumpily awakes. '**HROOOOM!** You have disturbed my slumber. I sense an aura around you, you are an adept. Show me your strength!'

RewardTables.message: A girl approaches you. She watched you battle the monster, and you think you saw her on top of the lighthouse you visited. 'Oh young Adept! You have shown remarkable strength! I will tell the guard to let you pass over the draw bridge after Kolima. I am in a hurry, are you on your way to Lama Temple? Let us meet there! Oh, sorry, I forgot to mention. My Name is Feizhi! Nice to meet you, bye!'

A bit out of breath, you look up. Tret is satisfied with your power and accepts his loss. You tell him what McCoy has asked you to deliver. Before Tret can respond, a loud roar grabs your attention. You come back to your senses, turn around, and see a fierce beast. Not a bear, not a lion... something *else*. Something that wields an enormous axe. It must have witnessed your battle. When it notices your gaze, it runs off. It didn't go far, so you track it down. You decide to catch your breath before you challenge it, though!

Matchups.Flavourtext: Was it a dream? Did you really just *punch* a tree? What a weird thought. Anyway, you head home.

Fuchin Temple.name: Fuchin Temple
Fuchin Temple.FlavourText: Just a small trek away from Kolima Bridge awaits Fuchin Temple. Upon entrance, you see a waterfall and in front of it, a monk... perhaps he is guarding something?

Matchups.Flavourtext: The cave behind the monk turns out to be writhing with monsters! They weren't joking about a test!
More beasts attack you from all directions, catching you off guard. From the ceiling, from the walls, from the water and the floor!
You find a gladiator struggling to go on. 'I'm too wimpy for this test! This cave is getting on my nerves. Hey, you look weak! Wanna fight?'
You make your way to a chest and open it, but hairy legs sprout out from under it. The chest is alive!
You spot a purple speck in the corner of your eye. Could it be? You finesse your away around to it, and lo and behold, a Jupiter Djinni!
An intense battle with the Djinni left you fatigued. After witnessing your tired form, a bony group rushes you.
The monks of the temple deem you worthy. They mentioned something about talking to monkeys in the forest? Whatever...

Mogall Forest.name: Mogall Forest
Mogall Forest.FlavourText: With the Fuchin monk's advice in mind, you enter the twisted sinister maze of a forest.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Centred in a small clearing is a tree stump, marking the entrance of the woods. Peering into its hollow, it is much deeper than you'd thought. Suddenly, a set of primal yellow eyes flicker up from the darkness and spot you.

After the battle with the furious ape, you proceed past the stump. Having heard quiet running from behind, you turn to see another ape coming at you. Turns out the first ape wasn't the only one in the trunk, and this time, there's a bunch!

A tiring battle with the apes left you facing the ground, panting hard. You notice tiny humanoid footsteps in the grass and follow it to a mystical area... perhaps elves exist? You barely have any time to take in your surroundings when you are attacked by a group of gnomes!
A puzzle of logs and stumps form a barricade in front of a small space between the woods, and chilling there, is a Venus Djinni! Disturbed, it attacks in a grumpy rage!
The loud battle with the Djinni seems to have upset the residents of the forest. You hurriedly try to go back to the clearing but your path is blocked by an unhappy bunch.
It is now apparent that you are an unwanted visitor in these woods. A loud roar from the trees beside you indicate the start of an ambush! All sorts of beasts hustle up to you in a swarm of madness.
After all of those battles and ambushes, you cannot wait to rest at the next town. Your hope, however, is crushed by an ape that stumbles in your path, trying to get a Tarantula out of its hair.
Thankfully, the end of the forest is in sight. You make your way out.

RewardTables.message: As you leave the forest, a soft breeze blows from the side. It smells of fresh flowers and plants. The source of the twirl is a shape floating in the air over the heather. The figure looks young, a girl with flowers twined through her hair. You try to sneak up, but she notices you, visibly startled. She floats away, throwing you cautious looks over her shoulder until she disappears into Mogall Forest. You start to feel the same breeze flowing through the endless woods. You must track her down!

Xian.name: Xian
Xian.FlavourText: Xian is a small town in the far east of Angara. It is the beginning of the silk road and is close to the fabled Lama Temple.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You finally leave the forest, what a relief! Some creatures are your welcome party.
Xian is small, but it looks cozy. It has a Kung Fu dojo, let's have a look!
Well *that* was underwhelming. And no one is wanting to fight you either, everyone is just looking for a certain Feizhi... Luckily, a little Djinni is playing in a puddle just outside!
Leaving the town didn't feel difficult, you really didn't get much out of it. In the wilds, however...! You get ambushed.

On the water side of a small headland you see a faint glow. You are attracted towards it, it makes you thirsty for a certain brew. The closer you get, the faster you walk, the more furious you become.
You nearly missed that djinn! You sense it's getting warmer and the air is getting more coarse, as if you were near a desert. In the distance you start to see a building, a temple even!

'Welcome! So you have made it'. A purple haired woman greets you. 'This is the one I was talking about! They are very talented!', a different, much younger purple haired woman claims. 'Very well. You must be very talented indeed, then. If you are ready to study under my ward, I may have a task or another for you.'

RewardTables.message: 'One year ago, the seal of alchemy was removed. Because of this, the elemental forces have yet to find their balance again. The road ahead leads to Lamakan desert, a very dangerous place. Before you get my guidance to pass through, I need you to explore an old mining town, just to the north from here. An ancient culture used to live there, and now their protectors often start to go wild and stir up trouble in the town. Can you take care of this matter?

The creatures were powered by ancient Mercury Psynergy, remnants from the ancient culture. And you say a white spirit was dwelling in the energy? Oh no, this means trouble... Please, inform me if you see more of these occurances.

 Now though, you want to cross the Lamakan Desert. You'll need guidance, as the desert is full of heat and traps. An Adept needs to reveal an oasis for you to cool off in. Feizhi, do you think you have mastered Reveal yet? Would you be so kind and accompany {0} through that hellish place?

So you saw another spirit? One with two swords? The elements are out of balance more than I anticipated. The spirits are loose and mischievous, they will probably hide in places full of elemental psynergy and drain them if left unchecked. We need to seek the spirits out, but be careful!

'Oh my, you look like you walked right into a snowstorm. Oh! You found Moloch, the spirit of the north wind absorbing the power of Mercury in order to freeze over the world. Long ago, the world was one enormous lump of ice, and Weyard since experience eras of intense cold. But to think that Weyard should become a white wasteland yet again is inconceivable. Thank you for taking care of the matter, and let me know if more spirits are up to similar mischief.'

'So Zagan, the demonic beast, claimed Weyard to be ruled by beasts, strengthened by alchemy? It is true that before us Humans, the animals were living where towns are now built. It came to a truce, but now the sudden eruption of alchemy is upsetting them...'

'Do you have news for me? Interesting. I felt the winds and aromatic breezes, I wasn't sure what to make of them. I had a feeling Flora, the flower spirit, was behind it. Before humans ruled the animals, and before that Weyard was filled with plants and flowers of all kinds and of incredible sizes. The plants won their reign over the cold wasteland that Weyard once was, but had to learn to live side by side with animals, and then us humans. At last, maybe her powers can be used to bring balance between the dominant natural forces.'

Altin.name: Altin
Altin.FlavourText: The winding, water-logged mining caverns hide many secrets and many dangers. An Adept who is clever, cautious, and courageous just might be able to navigate the mine's perils and reap rich rewards.

Matchups.Flavourtext: At the outskirts of Altin, you are ambushed by mighty rat warriors with no tolerance for intruders!
Altin is partially flooded! The townsfolk point you to the mine's entrance. The first thing you see is a treasure chest! But there's no such thing as free loot...
As you follow the railroad tracks deeper into the mine, the Halloween special assaults you!
A Djinni is playing in the floodwaters here. Light and refreshing!
A trail of ooze leads you onward. Careful, this could be a sticky situation!
Beyond the ooze trail in, you find a dragon-like statue that spews water. It'd be kind of cute, if it wasn't attacking!
The floodwaters recede after you defeat the first one, but it seems they've banded together now! Mo' Monsters, Mo' Problems.
The waters recede again, and a new path down is revealed. You reach the final chamber... Here comes the big one!
With all the statues defeated, the waters sink back down into the earth. Altin is still soaked, but it will dry out in time. You've done a very good deed today.

RewardTables.message: You slew the beast. It lets out a roar and magically turns into stone. You have fulfilled Hama's task. As you head out, you see a silhouette gliding away, disappearing in the sky. What could that have been? Yet another reason to head back to Hama and report this sighting.

Lamakan Desert.name: Lamakan Desert
Lamakan Desert.FlavourText: The hottest desert in Weyard has no mercy. You will need Hama's clearance to cross it. Let's hope that you and Feizhi don't lose your path.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You're facing a wall of sand and heat. Don't forget to bring some water, perhaps write your last words...
'This desert has some oases, but a lot of them are just mirages. My powers are not very strong yet, so we need to pick carefully'
'Look, over there one of the antlions has come out of his hole!'
While the desert is hot, many things have adapted to the environment.
Let's take a halt, and hopefully freshen up.
Night is settling in, the temperature is falling, and more creatures are coming out of their hideouts.
A sandstorm is whirling up, but wait, it's actually a monster!
Feizhi tries to cast Reveal on an Oasis spot but when she does, sensing her Jupiter Psynergy, a Djinni manifests itself and whirls up some sand.
'Oh no, it is really getting dark. Let's take one more break, we are close to the other side!'
This is the last cave... Let me channel my powers...' '***RROOOOAAAARRR!!!***' 'OH NO!'

RewardTables.message:
You defeated the giant monster, thank goodness! Now it's time to leave this hellish desert. Night is setting in, but it's hard to imagine that this place is going to get any nicer. All of a sudden, you hear a mischievous chuckle, spooky even. 'What's so funny?', Feizhi asks, but it was neither of the two of you. You turn around and in the distance, a few meters above the sand, a figure hovers. It's a girl, with the wings of an angel and two mighty blades in hands. She notices your glance, and flies off to the south.
'That must have been another spirit!', the Jupiter Adept declares. 'We need to inform Master Hama about it. Let's rest in Kalay and then we'll go back to the Lama Temple.'

Matchups.Flavourtext: The air around you appears to become cooler again. The mountains above you must shield off the hot climate from where your path leads to. At last you see some greens shining through the exit. You made it!

RewardTables.message:
Wait!', shouts Feizhi, as you were about to head into a more open area. 'ARGH, my head. It hurts. I think it's Hama. I think she's trying to tell us something. Please, slow down and let me sit. one second..'
> So you saw another spirit? One with two swords? The elements are out of balance more than I anticipated. The spirits are loose and mischievous, they will probably hide in places full of an element's psynergy and drain it. We need to seek them, but be careful! Perhaps you could revisit the lighthouse or the forests you have already been in.'

Kalay.name: Kalay
Kalay.FlavourText: The bustling seaside trading hub in the heart of Angara.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Sure, it's been days since you last had a warm meal, but still. Don't eat strange mushrooms...
Whoa! You nearly tripped. Who'd've thunk this little guy would be out here in the middle of nowhere?
You run into some Colosso hopefuls and local barflies who've imbibed a bit too much and are looking for a fight.
You stumble on a pack of robbers. Alas, where there are merchants, there will be thieves.
A wild Mars Djinni appears! Seems this spitfire will need some convincing before it joins your team.
You hear angry buzzing from nearby. What is it? Oh no, not the bees! Not the beeeeees!
You find the docks. Want to set sail? These rowdy dockhands need you to prove you're not just another landlubber!
Seems you've disturbed some monsters! I wonder if they're guarding anything...
It's getting dark and in the distance you see the towers of Hammet's palace. Time to head to the inn.

Gondowan Cave.name: Gondowan Cave
Gondowan Cave.FlavourText: The dank environment of Gondowan Cave makes for the perfect home for trolls and ogres alike. Having been unexplored for ages, who knows what else could be lurking about?

Matchups.Flavourtext: You enter the cave, where an Orc is standing guard at the entrance. Calling out for his friends, he lashes out violently at you!
Ahead of you, the cave rumbles violently with the trampling of countless monsters. Before you'd even gotten anywhere, the first platoon of beasts arrive. Defend!
As you progress through the cave, you sight a doomsayer just as the next monster squad arrives right behind you.
The rumbling stops, and the cave is absolutely silent. You keep walking until you feel a faint hand on your shoulder. Ghosts!
Your path is blocked by a ring of doomsayers doing a ritual. Before your eyes, from the depths of the dark circle arises a demon. The doomsayer from earlier spots you and alarms the others. Fight!
A lone warrior is battling some monsters in preparation for Colosso. He asks for a friendly sparring match. Sure!

Hsu bows in recognition of your prowess, and tells you he thought he spotted something of interest at a particular corner of this cave system. Following his directions, and after solving a puzzle, you come face-to-snout with a Djinni!
The third and final beast gang arrives just as another demon emerges from the ritual and blocks the exit. Battle!
Finally you reach the end of the cave and step out into sunlight.

Karagol Sea.name: Karagol Sea
Karagol Sea.FlavourText: The vast Karagol Sea! Its waters have claimed many an incautious sailor's life, and its monsters still more.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You stand at the rail of the ship, watching the Kalay Docks grow smaller. The sea breeze cools you and brings with it the smell of salt. As you contemplate the adventures that await you, someone approaches. A blue-haired fellow with the look of a warrior greets you, and you fall into easy conversation about this year's Colosso. When the warrior, Sean, learns that you know your way around the battlefield, he asks if you'd like to spar.

Sean is a gracious loser, and he thanks you for the chance to practice a bit more before the Colosso trials. You're then congratulated by a newcomer, who must have shown up while you were busy with your match. The red-haired man introduces himself as Sean's partner Ouranos and asks if you'd mind giving him a chance to try his strength as well.

Your defeat of both Sean and Ouranos seems to have gained you their respect. The three of you spend the afternoon swapping stories and cementing your new friendship. An interruption comes all too soon, however, with a cry from the crow's nest: 'Monsters sighted off the port side! All hands, prepare for boarders!'

After defeating the monsters, you and several other warriors on the ship meet with Kaja, one of the senior crew members. He tells you that monster attacks have been on the rise, so the crew will need your help to fend them off if everyone is to get to Tolbi safely. You and the rest of the warriors divide up the ship into which regions you'll defend, and only moments after you do so, another wave of monsters is spotted, this one fiercer than the last.

There's no time to rest. Despite your best efforts, some of the oarsmen have been injured by the swarm of monsters. A few of the warriors leave the deck to take up oars, lending their brawn to the cause. Passengers lend a hand as well, some less enthusiastically than others. Those of you who remain in the fight brace yourselves for the next attack.

'Land ho!' A frantic voice calls from the lookout. You wake up from the quick nap you took. It's hard to make out what you are squinting at on the horizon. Is that Tolbi already...? A mighty wave rises out of the Karagol, blocking the shore from view and sending you stumbling as the ship heaves. When you regain your footing, your stomach drops. There, lounging on the foredeck, tentacles wrapped around the bowsprit, sits a beast you thought mere legend - a Kraken.
Seasick and exhausted you set foot on land again. What a trip.

Tolbi.name: Tolbi
Tolbi.FlavourText: On the south side of Karagol sea lies the huge city of Tolbi. One year ago it was under the leadership, or *regime* as it's told, of Babi, but now Iodem sits on the throne. What might be his secrets? The town is full of tourists, merchants, soldiers... It looks like they are getting ready for an event!

Matchups.Flavourtext: Ahh, the glorious city of Tolbi. You have heard a lot about it and you head straight to the famous fountain to try your luck. As you approach, you see that it is full of monsters...
While fighting those monsters, you saw a glowing shadow slipping by a house. You decide to follow it. Wait, a glowing shadow? That doesn't make any... whooah, it's a Djinni!
As you come back to the main square, you witness some thugs trying to steal a poor merchants cob of corn. You step in.
Sigh... The commotion has alarmed the guards. You just wanted to help, right? You destroyed the whole market and burned down half a house, but no one could have seen that coming, right? ......Right?

The guards tell you that you are under arrest. They can't bring you there themselves, because they're injured too much, but give you the directions. On the way there you walk by some gladiators training. Let's say hello!

RewardTables.message: You show the guards the letter you found hidden in Altmiller Cave. Baffled by Iodem's signature, they point you to the finalists' VIP area.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You're done with this city. Too big, too strange. You start exploring the outskirts.
The sky becomes overcast and something hard hits your head.
Before the weather gets worse, you take shelter in a nearby cave.
You realize that you are just walking around Karagol Sea. Let's head in the other direction!

As you cross over to the continent of Gondowan, you face a desert. It surely is going to be hot and you won't be able to stop sweating. You wish you'd brought a change of clothes. Back to Tolbi, for now.

RewardTables.message: You once again spot the spirit you have been seeing. 'You... You can see me? So that's why you followed me... You must be an Adept. I am looking for someone I can trust. Follow me and show me what you're capable of.'

Altmiller Cave.name: Altmiller Cave
Altmiller Cave.FlavourText: Providing shelter from the rain, you realize just how massive the cave system is. What might it hide?

Matchups.Flavourtext: You immediately come face to face with some stone monsters, ready to sock it to you. What a lousy greeting party...
Having been...greeted, more creatures come your way. Quite the popular one, aren't you?

You'd heard from somewhere that a previous party of Adepts had found and rescued Tolbi's late leader, Babi from these caves. He wanted them to find some 'draught' of some kind deep in the cave. Being the explorer you are, you decide to play scavenger, to see if there's anything remaining down there.
You find a chest...and wouldn't you know it, the chest is angry. Not your day, is it?
Reaping your rewards, and questioning whether or not they were worth it, you continue onward.
Monsters, monsters, monsters....who *doesn't* love monsters, right?
You enter a room with fallen pillars, and start pushing them around, finding a Djinni. He's *also* angry today, and it looks like he's itching for a fight.
This cave seems endless. Still, there might be more to find down here. You press on, and run directly into some twisted hounds and their keeper.

`(A puzzle is coming up, you may want to pause this by reacting anywhere with ` :pause_button: `to have time to figure it out!)`

You eventually find a room with five stones placed in a line, with strange lights on the wall. Attached to the wall is a note. It reads:
```Blue is next to Green
Red is on an edge
White is neither next to Red nor Yellow
Blue and Yellow share a Neighbour
White is further left than Red.

Where is Yellow?```
Unsure of why it mentions colors, you wish Feizhi had accompanied you on this trip. Perhaps Reveal would show the colors of the stones? You've come this far, might as well attempt to solve the riddle.
As you touch the correct stone, you hear a voice inside your head. ```Which stone is in the middle?```

You shout the answer. The stones start radiating and a previously hidden door appears in the stone wall, revealing a small room. It smells like a pharmacy, but it's completely empty, except for a small letter.

RewardTables.message:
'Congratulations, Adept. You have mastered the puzzles put in by our late Lord Babi. He surely would have admired your skills, and thus your talent shall be rewarded. Show this letter to the guards at Colosso. You may proudly show your strength at the Colosso Tournament.

Lord Iodem'

Colosso Trials.name: Colosso Trials
Colosso Trials.FlavourText: The Colosso tournament is the biggest event across Weyard. Warriors from all over the world are trying to compete in the tournament. Beat the trials, and you might have a shot as the finalist.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Round 1: You're up against Buford. He looks threatening in his black armor, yet you can feel his fear deep inside.
Round 2: Dekka must win the finals. Dekka. Dekka.
Round 3: Don't let Navampa's pink armor deceive you, because this warrior is much stronger than he looks like.. Good luck!
Round 4: Satrage, the fourth Warrior. You watched him meditate before battle. He is prepared for you.
Round 5: Galahad's name incites the stories of the fabled knight of the round table. But by the clanking of Galahad's armor, you *know* that he is more afraid of you than you are of him.
Round 6: Azart trusts no one. You saw him in the audience of the previous battles, he watched your every move. Careful, and good luck.

Round 7: The final round of the trials. So far you have done well, but here comes your toughest opponent. Morgan, and his energy is ahead of him. He strikes powerfully, let's hope you can find his weakness.
Morgan falls, defeated, and the crowd cheers. You have completed the Trials, and shown yourself worthy to fight in the Finals. The Tolbi guards nod respectfully to you as you leave the arena.

Colosso Finals.name: Colosso Finals
Colosso Finals.FlavourText: You have made the finals! Contrary to previous years, you are asked to not just use your muscles, but also your head.

Matchups.Flavourtext: The Warriors of Vale once saved Weyard from dying. Who is the oldest Valean Hero?
Your first fight in the finals, Azart. Good luck!
Which Item protects its wearer from the effects of the curse effect?
Satrage glances at you through the slits of his helmet. Good luck!
Which chute do you slide down from?
The final fight until you win the tournament! A fiery Navampa charges at you. Pull through!
What's that, another puzzle? Take a breath, think about this! You are facing four puppets dressed as Gladiators with nametags on them. Who is not competing in the tournament?
Oh no. The rumors were true! A fourth fight! An unknown warrior, masked and cloaked. You sense Psynergy, watch out.

The Adept nods to you, acknowledging defeat. The crowd roars their approval around you as you are presented with your prizes. As the guards of Tolbi escort you out of the arena, they slap you on the shoulder in congratulation, and tell you that you can now join the Tolbi Guard if you ever want to give up the adventuring business.

RewardTables.message: Congratulations, Adept! You've proven to be exceedingly strong! You may now fight in the Endless battle mode!

Suhalla Desert.name: Suhalla Desert
Suhalla Desert.FlavourText: Suhalla Desert, a barren, windblown landscape. Traveling through here will be an endeavor.

Matchups.Flavourtext: As you enter the Suhalla Desert, everything seems to be still aside from it being little windy. Rumor persist of tornadoes blocking the way to Lalivero, or even abducting people! You step into the desert and are met immediately by some unfriendly denizens.

As you pass into a canyon area, the wind picks up and a tornado bars your way. As you stand and watch it for a while, it slows down, seemingly puzzled, and the settling dust reveals a red Tornado Lizard! It seems like these sandy devils have inhabited the desert!
After defeating the Lizard, you come to a junction. Even with the winds blowing, monsters teem within this desert.
Another pair of Lizards! It seems there are quite a few of them.
Going further, the winds starts to slow down. You still have some trouble seeing, but can barely make out a chest! Upon opening it, it turned out to be a Mimic!
With a bit of treasure in your pockets, you start making your way towards the other end of the desert. Some trolls take exception to your passing by their home.
More Tornado Lizards. You hope this is the last of them.

As you round a bend, the canyon opens up. You start to stroll across the flat area, when a tornado swoops in from behind and catches you! As your feet begin to rise off the ground, you must decide: Which Psynergy do you use?
Brushing sand off yourself, you continue across the open plain. It looks like the coast is clear, except... BOOM! A group of Stone Soldiers appeared!
After getting past all the explosions (without looking) a group of Magicore show up! Surely you're almost through the desert by now..!

You see green on the other side of a ravine... but a giant tornado bars your way! You channel your Psynergy, and the lizard slows and drops you from the tornado. He seems to be green instead of red, so he's probably stronger than the others...
You escape Suhalla Desert, but not without getting clothes full of sand. You lay foot on some sweet sweet green grass again, and sigh in relief.

Suhalla Desert Junction.name: Suhalla Desert Junction
Suhalla Desert Junction.FlavourText: Backtracking into the windswept desert, you see a path you didn't follow on the way through... Perhaps something interesting lurks this way?

Matchups.Flavourtext: After backtracking from the Storm Lizard, you look back at the chasm you couldn't cross. Hmm... is that a secret passage across the way there? You climb carefully down the wall... then something blinding catches your eye!

Phew...after the battle, it seemed it was actually a fire Djinni just trying to make some friends! He really played rough... Now, where does this cave go? On the other side, it's a massive red Tornado! You focus your Psynergy again. It looks like Storm Lizard's grandpa isn't happy you did that...
Well that was a weird encounter? The lizard starts spinning and flies off as a colorful tornado. Where does it go, though? If you're fast enough you can follow it!

Lalivero.name: Lalivero
Lalivero.FlavourText: Lalivero, the town under the shadow of two lighthouses. The inhabitants are somewhat mistrustful of outsiders due to being forced to build one of them by the nearby city of Tolbi, but the inn will happily take your coins before you continue on your journey.

Matchups.Flavourtext: A small narrow passage way makes travel tricky. It's not *that* hard, but the monsters in your way don't make it any easier.
You nearly slip but another ledge catches your fall. Luckily, otherwise you wouldn't have met this little guy!
At the foot of the Venus Lighthouse you start walking towards the small town of Lalivero. The sun is burning down, yet a cool breeze blows over from the ocean.
On the horizon Lalivero's city wall starts to appear. From the roadside, however, some monsters are trying to stop you from getting there.
Lalivero is small and cozy. The town is thriving from building the late Lord Babi's Lighthouse. Without the funds from Tolbi, there wouldn't have been much business.

The presence of guards is concerning, but the light of the close Venus Lighthouse surely has awakened the exploration lust of some monsters... The building site of the non-elemental lighthouse seems to be an especially active place.
From a distance you spot a shimmer, as if coming from a torch. Curiously, you check it out.
In the town's inn you listen to Faran talk about some Valeans and Proxians that came through a year or so ago. The stories are interesting, but you need to move on.

Venus Lighthouse.name: Venus Lighthouse
Venus Lighthouse.FlavourText: The Lighthouse holding the power of Earth. It might be the end of your journey... or the beginning of a new one?

Matchups.Flavourtext: Just outside the lighthouse, the welcoming committee has been waiting for you... for way too long, it seems.
As you enter, you find a gap too big to be jumped above and strange grey carved blocks. It looks like you can use them to cross, what Psynergy do you use?
As the next group of monsters finds you, you pause. Fire, Ice, Lightning. Now that one's a common trope.
These lumps of clay are blocking the way through the next door.
An army of mythical beasts stands between you and the stairs up the lighthouse!
A bunch of energy lines are etched into the floor. An electrician should probably fix those, they could be a potential safety hazard. Watch out, don't get zapped.

Those lizards left a bit of an electric aftertaste in your mouth.
The place is completely dried out. What looks like were once water lines are now filled with sand. It's incredibly hard to move around in this maze, as if some ghostly spirits were messing with you. But you _really_ need to get to this chest!
This place is complete madness. There's more monsters than you could have ever imagined.
As you enter the next room, you're surprised by some royalty and their guard dogs.
You climb and climb higher, you're getting closer to the top. From a window a bunch of feathered beasts ambush you. They seem very unimpressed by the intense Venus psynergy that surrounds this place.

At last you reach the aerie. Something tells you that things similar to the events at the peak of the Mercury Lighthouse will wait for you. You take a break and heal up before you take the elevator to the aerie.

RewardTables.message:
(Story parts for {0}, will contain spoilers for everyone else!)
||You reach the aerie. On the ledge of the middle platform, a blonde woman and a blue haired man are waiting silently. The flickering of the beacon's light can only indicate a spirit drawing on its power. They spot you, and without a moment of hesitation, start to charge!||

Matchups.Flavourtext: The lighthouse illuminates the aerie with the tan-white blaze of the Venus beacon. Similarly to the top of Mercury Lighthouse, you're met with the faces of the two legendary warriors. By now you're aware that they are illusions, created by the Lighthouse in self-defense. The illusions of Saturos and Menardi are prepared to defend the lighthouse.

RewardTables.message:
(Story parts for {0}, will contain spoilers for everyone else!)
||You defeated Saturos and Menardi. As you look up, dark clouds cover the sky and a red mist appears in the air around you. The lighthouse is starting to shake under your feet, its light becoming dimmer and dimmer. From behind the glow of the Lighthouse beacon, you start to see a shadow. A colossal black figurine hovers in the air. It is wearing a demon-horned helm and is armed to the teeth. A gigantic sword and shield float by its side. The earthquake intensifies, and you struggle to keep your balance.
A deep roar resounds as the lighthouse summons its image of a gargantuan, two headed dragon. The dragon immediately goes for the dark spirit, but you are caught up in the cross fire. Watch out!||

Matchups.Flavourtext: Seemingly unharmed, the illusions of Saturos and Menardi flicker and disappear into thin air. You feel the ground underneath your feet tremble... Something big is coming.

RewardTables.message:
(Story parts for {0}, will contain spoilers for everyone else!)
||At some point during the fight, the black spirit withdrew, leaving just you and the dragon to brawl against each other. As you slay the dragon, it disappears into thin air. The sky begins to clear and the red mist rolls away, heading south. 'That was the danger I was afraid of. We must stop it.' Megaera is right. This is a danger to all of Weyard.||

Matchups.Flavourtext: You have won the fight! There is nothing left to do on this lighthouse, other than leaving and finally getting some good rest. Well done.

RewardTables.message:
(Story parts for {0}, will contain spoilers for everyone else!)
||As you leave for the lighthouse elevator, thunder booms, shaking the very air around you. You wonder how thunder can sound so angry. While you can, you take the chance to look south. On the horizon you can make out the black-red storm clouds that blackened the sky above you earlier. Is this where your path will lead you next?||

> Thank you for playing the first part of this Discord fan game! I sincerely hope you enjoyed it. The continuation is already in the works, so make sure to stick around for when it is done! You can give yourself the Colosso Adept role using `i!giverole ColossoAdept`, to get informed when it is done as soon as possible. Until then, spend your time keep exploring, break your record in endless battles or engage in PvP brawls and most importantly, stay awesome!

~Floowey

Babis Lighthouse.name: Babis Lighthouse
Babis Lighthouse.FlavourText: A Lighthouse built by Babi in order to find the city of Lemuria. The tower is built on top of the Tunnel Ruins, the passage way to Venus Lighthouse...

Matchups.Flavourtext: Even before you can enter, a bouncer and his two assistants try to stop you. Is this place booked by A-list monsters?
As you work your way up the lighthouse, you find more monsters. This version of Snow White and the Seven Dwarves might not end as well as the original...
That leap of faith was awarded by a meeting with a Djinni!
The bouncer you beat at the entry called some backup! Let's get this party started!
You've now reached the Tunnel Ruins. One thing doesn't change: Monsters are there to make it difficult.
You puzzle your way through the riddles and riddle yourself through the puzzles. You have to choose going left or going right,

Let's start left.
It looks like a party of warriors has tried this before you, though...
Time to check out the right path. You stumble upon some sort of a secret, monsterous society...

`(A puzzle is coming up, you may want to pause this by reacting anywhere with ` :pause_button: `to have time to figure it out!)`

In the room are five colorful statues (Red, Blue, Yellow, Green and Purple) standing in a cross formation:
```
R...B
..Y..
G...P
```
The statues are speaking to your soul...
```
Oh Adept, we can feel your glance. Will you help to make us dance?

Blue and Red are swapping spots, around the clock we move one slot.
Switching now are Blue and Green. Purple, meanwhile, is going in.
Yellow and Blue are locking their eyes, the group dances one step counterclockwise.
Green wants the center, as Red tries to enter. The one further right will have to surrender.
Without a delay, we'll dance our ballet. The one who's south-west will get in midway.

Now tell us the answer to our small riddle, which color is now in the middle?
```
The statues start to glow and you hear the opening of a door. You start hearing some powerful music... This must be the way to Venus Lighthouse!

Crossbone Isle.name: Crossbone Isle
Crossbone Isle.FlavourText: The fabled home of the pirate king, Deadbeard, who is said to guard a treasure hoard.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You've made it to the island! It's a quick walk to the cave entrance. As you enter cautiously, some monsters take exception to your presence here!
After hopping across dozens of platforms, you exit the first room and travel down the staircase... only to find company waiting for you.
Having heaved fallen columns out of your way, you pass through the second room. The guardians of the next level await...
You collect the key from the third room and pass through the final door and down the stairs. A matched pair of gryphons greets you.
The statue's sharp eyes in the next room were no match for your stealth and Psynergy. You peer downward, and the staircase seems endless, disappearing into darkness...
After an eternity of fiddling with logs and underground dam controls, you exit the fifth room and head downwards once more. A pair of chimeras swoops down from above to challenge you.
As you work your way through the maze of ladders and pillars, you spy the familiar shape of a Djinni!
With the sixth room behind you, the stairway down beckons. You answer its siren call, and find guards awaiting you at the next puzzle room door.

You're beginning to tire from so many battles and using your Psynergy so much, but you gamely haul blocks around until you can escape the room. You squint down the staircase... surely it can't be long now. In the meantime, more monsters stand between you and your goal.
A quartet of eerie howls meet your ears as you exit the puzzle room and begin down the stairs once more. Oh boy...
You enter the door and begin rolling logs across the pool. As you do, you spot a treasure chest. Is this the legendary treasure cache? As you reach for it, the chest sprouts teeth. Guess not!

You finally reach the bottom of the stairs. A rotting ship lies here, so you climb aboard, searching for the fabled treasure. The rattle of bones and the clatter of armor greets you instead. Glowing yellow eyes lurch toward you with remarkable speed!

You don't see the vast piles of treasure you'd hoped for, but you help yourself to some of the nice things you spot after the fight is over. Deadbeard has been vanquished, and you are very ready for a long nap.

Path of Gaia I.name: Path of Gaia I
Path of Gaia I.FlavourText: Venus, Earth, or Gaia. Hama will teach you about the virtue of a Venus Adept.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome, Adept. I see you carry the power of Earth inside of you. I will teach you what it is like to be a true Venus Adept. Being a Venus Adept means combining all the qualities of a virtuous fighter. You are the force and you are the wall.'
You are the damage and you are the cure. So fight, fight like your life depends on it! Because it does...'
You are life and you are death. Let your enemies feel the power of the earth.'

You are the judge and the executioner. Keep that in mind. Make your choices with Weyard in mind. You have done well! To prove yourself as a Venus Adept, you must conquer the Venus spirit inside of you.'

Very well, Adept! You have proven you can stand your ground. Next, I would like to show you the fantastic world of Weyard. Come to me again, once you have grown stronger and learned more about the secrets of Earth.'

Path of Gaia II.name: Path of Gaia II
Path of Gaia II.FlavourText: Hama will take you on a field lesson about the sandy history of Venus Adepts

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome back. I see you have grown a lot stronger. Let me show you the origins of the Venus Clan. Take my hand, quick!'

An ear ringing 'WHOOSH!' hollers through your ears and you feel warmth all over your body. As you open your eyes, you find yourself surrounded by sand. In the distance you see the peak of a lighthouse.
The Venus Clan once lived under the foot of the Venus Lighthouse. They built and protected it. You can see some remains of their culture buried in the sand.'

Jupiter stands opposed to Venus. They are natural counterparts. No, *not* natural enemies. However, you still need to keep in mind the balance of the elements. It was no accident the Venus Clan went extinct. The winds in the desert just grew too strong... they protected the lighthouse until their very end...'
Slaying those beasts was a challenge. Hama chuckles slightly after seeing you exhausted. 'Haha, did you *feel* the power of the wind?'. Take a quick break to replenish your energies.
Then let me now reveal the last remains of the Venus Clan. In here, we will find the spirit of the great king and leader, well the *pharaoh* of the lost tribe. ***Ramses.***'

Do you now better understand the element of Earth? Yes? Here we witnessed death and devastation of an entire culture, buried under their own homeland. Continue your exploration throughout Weyard and visit me again when your are stronger. Next we will explore what *life* is capable of doing.'

Path of Gaia III.name: Path of Gaia III
Path of Gaia III.FlavourText: In some deep woods, Hama will show you the power that Venus exceeds, if left on her own.

Matchups.Flavourtext: I was expecting your arrival. Every time we've met, the aura of your Psynergy has become stronger and stronger. Take my hand. We are heading into the depths of Kolima forest, impassable by normal means.
With a 'WHOOSH!' you teleport onto a small glade. The air is fresh and smells of pine needles and all kinds of flowers. You are surrounded by trees as far as the eye can see.

Those bees you just felled... they aren't evil monsters, they just try to protect their habitat. You also just tried to save your life, that is understandable. Life is a battle.
This area of the forest was practically never visited by mankind. However, it is said that some sylvan-dwelling elves are roaming the area.'
Let's head deeper into the woods. As you might have guessed, we are looking for something.
The thicket is getting thicker and more dense. We ought to be close. The plants are *not* happy that we are here.'

The spirit seems unharmed, visibly satisfied with the fight and willing to share its powers with you. 'Did you *see* that?', Hama shouts out with excitement. 'Being a Jupiter Adept, I never would have dreamt of getting so close to this magnificent creature. And you bested it on top of that! You clearly are a virtuous and strong Venus Adept. I will take you back to a safe place now. I wish you all the best, may Venus shine her light on you.'

'The spirit seems unharmed, visibly satisfied with the fight and willing to share its powers with you. 'Did you *see* that?', Hama shouts out with excitement. 'Being a Jupiter Adept, I never would have dreamt of getting so close to this magnificent creature. And you bested it on top of that! You clearly are a virtuous and strong Venus Adept. I will take you back to a safe place now. I wish you all the best, may Venus shine her light on you.'

Path of Gaia IV.name: Path of Gaia IV
Path of Gaia IV.FlavourText: Hama sends you off to a journey of moral and dilemma - are you a worthy Venus Adept?

Matchups.Flavourtext: You approach Hama once more. She looks you over, nodding. 'Your path is not yet complete, but I cannot guide you further. Go out into the world. As a wise Venus Adept once said, _'This is your journey now._'

You pick a direction at random and begin your journey. Suddenly *BONK*, something drops on your head. A squirrel has dropped hard nut from a tree above. You pick it up, slowly, as to not scare the creature. The squirrel timidly approaches, from the other side a crow glides down and looks at the nut. What do you do with it?
Your path takes you into farmlands surrounded by forest, and eventually you come to a cottage in the middle of a field. As you approach, you see a bear attacking the farmer. What do you do?
You draw your weapon and ready your Psynergy and Djinn. The bear turns on you as you approach.

With the threat ended, the farmer is most grateful. He invites you in and serves you a hearty plate of roast mutton with vegetables. As you're eating, a scraggly-looking fox approaches the cottage. The farmer grabs his pitchfork. 'Varmint,' he grumbles. As you take in the scene, you spot the bright eyes of fox pups peering out of the undergrowth.

You walk closer on your own pace. You watch the farmer heft a four-pronged pitchfork. It looks clumsy, but it's enough to scare off the bear. 'Thanks for nothing!', he shouts at you. Still, he invites you in and serves you a hearty plate of roast mutton with vegetables. As you're eating, a scraggly-looking fox approaches the cottage. The farmer again grabs his pitchfork. 'Varmint,' he grumbles. As you take in the scene, you spot the bright eyes of fox pups peering out of the undergrowth.
You draw your weapon and stride out to meet the fox. The pups flee into the woods, but it stands its ground, shaking. It is determined to protect its life and offspring.

With a full belly, the fox feeds her pups and scampers off. They will live another day and be able to hunt again, thanks to your kindness. 'I suppose that's one way of handling it,' says the farmer. Just then, a trumpet sounds. Your host grimaces, but directs you outside. A lord and his retinue have just arrived.
The farmer relays the story of your kindness, and the lord nods. 'You have my thanks.' He pauses. 'Say, you look like you know yourselves around animals and are a good hand in a fight. My servants are harvesting wood to expand my holdings in this area, but they're being attacked by wolves. Take this axe, and end this threat to my people and property.' He holds out a very well-made axe.

With the fox slain, the farmer smiles and nods to you. Just then, a trumpet sounds. Your host grimaces, but directs you outside. A lord and his retinue have just arrived.
The farmer relays the story of your kindness, and the lord nods. 'You have my thanks.' He pauses. 'Say, you look like you know yourselves around animals and are a good hand in a fight. My servants are harvesting wood to expand my holdings in this area, but they're being attacked by wolves. Take this axe, and end this threat to my people and property.' He holds out a very well-made axe.
When you decline, the lord loses his temper. 'Guards!' he cries. 'Seize this ingrate!' His men immediately draw their weapons against you.

Following the itch of battle and treasure, you make your way into the nearby woods. The chopping of the lumberjacks beckons you forward. But as you draw closer, a sudden howl is answered by another, and another. It dawns on you that a pack of hungry wolves has surrounded you.

After knocking out the noble's guards, you escape and head into the woods. You aim to stop the needless destruction of the forest for personal profit. You arrive in the glade where the lumberjacks are camped out, and call for them to stop. They do, but only at the shout of a guard in magically glowing armor. They surround you on all sides, brandishing their woodcutting axes. They look hungry and pitifully armed, but they also look serious about trying to hurt you. The guard, perhaps the only skilled combatent among them, orders the attack.

The lumberjacks' weapons are no match for your armor and Psynergy defenses. Though you raise no weapon against them, they realize how foolish it was to attack you. Their anger turns to terror, and they flee, leaving their axes behind. Suddenly, the trees around you start moving. From the bushes, some familiar animals emerge, and yet... they now have a glowing aura. 'You challenge the forces of nature,' they claim in chorus. 'You claim to protect us, but we did not ask for your protection. Prove to us, the flora and fauna of the forest and Mother Nature herself, that you are worthy.'

Path of Magma I.name: Path of Magma I
Path of Magma I.FlavourText: Mars, Fire and Magma. Hama will teach you how to bridle your inner flame.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Hello, Adept of the Martian element. I can feel your energy from here! You might think that fire is all about force and destruction. You would be thinking wrong, in that case! Let me show you what it is like to be connected to Mars.'

You might be wondering what else there is, right? Fire itself causes destruction, is unstoppable and blind of rage. It can burn down whole continents if out of control. So you, young Mars Adept, must master control over your element.'
Mars is warmth and light. A campfire at night, a torch in the dark. It can protect and provide safety. Let your fiery passion run, but be wise about it.'

Halt for a moment! See how more and more enemies are attracted by the light you create? Let them have their comfort. Rather than fighting them, show me what you have learned. Can you feel and challenge the Mars spirit inside of you?'

Well done, you have indeed understood. I would like to show you some of the Mars hotspots all over Weyard, but first you need to focus your energy on becoming stronger. Visit me again when you are ready!'

Path of Magma II.name: Path of Magma II
Path of Magma II.FlavourText: Hot places channel Mars psynergy, Hama will show you the spirits found there.

Matchups.Flavourtext: So you have come! Your progress is noticeable. Let me show you the hotspots of Weyard.

With a quick 'Whoop!' Hama teleports the both of you. You find yourself in a dry heat, surrounding by sand and more sand. You are not sure if the heat is making you stronger or weaker, but it's an uncomfortable feeling, regardless. If you had only brought another set of clothes. 'Welcome to Lamakan! Believe it or not, but we are not far from my home, the Lama Temple. I see you feel the heat? Take it, bundle it, make the best of it. Here you can try the limits of your power!'

Let me cool off a bit.', the Jupiter Adept chuckles, while suddenly appearing soaking wet - and not from sweating. 'The desert is filled with small oases. A Jupiter Adept can reveal them! Hold still, you will find a lot of creatures coming closer to drink.'

Those oasis creatures give you quite the trouble, yes? Naturally, they're water creatures! Keep in mind that as a Mars Adept you are opposed to Mercury. These creatures right here have adapted very well to their surroundings. But the desert has more to offer. Don't worry, I realize that Mars is not exactly known to have healing qualities. Let me get you back up on your feet!'

Salamanders are creatures we say are 'cold blooded'. They depend on the sun to regulate their inner temperature. You, on the other hand, are 'warm blooded'.
Yet, despite the natural fire you host, you have to be able to keep your composure at all times in order to make good decisions. This is a vital quality for a Mars Adept. But enough talk, fight these monsters with my advice in mind.'

The time has come for the real secret of this desert. You are going to face a spirit considered to be the king of the animals. Kirin is its name, and it is said to appear near people with a formidable destiny.
Prove to Kirin that you have what it takes to face anything!'

Kirin stares at you intensely before roaring one last time and leaping away, as if the fight never happened. You look at Hama, who's nodding with a little smile. 'You have made some progress, but you'll need to become much stronger before your next lesson. Good luck, young Adept.'

Path of Magma III.name: Path of Magma III
Path of Magma III.FlavourText: Hama wants to show you the origins of Mars Adepts, but the location might surprise you.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Our last adventure was an interesting ride. This time we will try to find the roots of Mars Adepts. We need to go to a place... not exactly screaming of Mars Psynergy, but don't let it deceive you.'

*WHOOP!*
You are surrounded by ice and mountains, in a corner of a small cave. The horizon is lit by a faint, red glow. Hama was right, not exactly the place you expected. But you can clearly feel the heat and energy coming from deep below your feet.

Have you ever heard of the tribe of Prox? The are the guardians of the Mars Lighthouse, they form the Mars Clan. Although they appear humanoid, they are distinct in that they have draconic features. They have adapted well and have no trouble surviving the eternal cold, here in the north.'
Dragons are said to master Mars Psynergy. This is not quite true. Although the majority of dragons breath fire, dragons can be aligned to any of the four elements.'
This cave is full of fiery dragons, that's for sure. Watch them carefully, you can learn alot from them, like how best to channel your inner flame.'

From the depths of the cave you hear a mighty roar. 'Could this be?', the purple haired woman wonders cautiously. You go deeper into the cave and encounter a massive dragon. Something is different to the others, though. The dragon looks much older, much more magical. It shoots a fire ball just above your heads, but it clearly didn't intend to hit you.
