It stands up and is even more impressive than before. It looks at you, slightly demanding, slightly condescending. Ready your weapon!

The dragon lets out a roar, clearly satisfied with itself, but just as much with you. 'Do you know who you just met?', the Jupiter Adept said, also just as satisfied. 'Tiamat. The mother, no, *queen* of dragons. Bow. *Bow*, I said. She is supposedly one of the oldest creatures living on this planet, even older than Poseidon. This is a great honor.'

Path of Magma IV.name: Path of Magma IV
Path of Magma IV.FlavourText: An astral spectacle is expected over Weyard - but first, how well do you know the stars?

Matchups.Flavourtext: Hama greets you as you arrive. 'Welcome, wielder of flame.' She teleports you both to a great plateau overlooking the continent of Indra. 'Your arrival is timely. You have shown mastery of your internal fire and trained in tempering the Mars sources in Weyard. But did you know there is yet one more source of fire?'

She offers a smile to your puzzlement, and gestures upwards, into a perfectly clear sky filled with stars. 'The heavens above also burn, like bright coals after a bonfire. Their flame helped give rise to ours here in Weyard.'
 She glances up, and nods. 'We still have time. Since today we are dealing with astral forces, we must also learn about the zodiac signs. Each zodiac sign is associated with one of the elements.'

Hama shows you a vision of twelve statues arrayed. 'One for each zodiach sign. They are from far from here, in the Craggy Peak Ruins.

Can you identify the three zodiac signs associated with Mars?'
Leo, the noblest of the Zodiac signs. Its visage is akin the sun. Only flame can sate the lion's hunger.'
Look there. The ram, it cowers from the flame. It's stubborn, it has an undying flame that powers its heart. Still, it avoids fire.'
Sagittarius, the Archer. Fight fire with fire, it is said. Sagittarius has realised, the archer's deadliest foe is himself.'
Gemini, the sign of the twins. Their wit and their mysterious connection comes from Jupiter.'
Hama chuckles gently. 'You thought you were really clever there, right? But no, I'm afraid Aquarius does not even get its power from Mercury. In fact Jupiter is Aquarius' Master.'
Libra, the Scale under the Jupiter star. Say Adept, do you know how to judge justice and balance?'
Virgo, protectress of the harvest. A gallant knight guards the noble Venus sign on her every step.'
You are a funny one. No, Pisces, the sign of the fish, is a sign under Mercury.'
Cancer, the sign of the crab lives in Mercury's seas. Beware its claws, they regrow in time!'
Ah, Scorpio. No. Mercury grants Scorpio its powers. Have a care, its tail bears a mighty poison.'
Capricorn, the goat. It's a cousin to a Mars Zodiac sign, but it draws its power from Venus.'
Taurus? No. It's hot headed, that's for sure, but as it stampedes over vast prairies, Venus gives it its strength.'

Very good,' Hama smiles. 'You have shown deep knowledge of the Zodiac signs and their elements. Now, let us go to the highest point of Dehkan Plateau. You have a rare opportunity, and we must not miss it.'

Hama pauses after you answer correctly for the third time in a row. 'Hmm... Typically quick wit and wisdom are neither of Mars' strong suites. I am impressed.' The statues of the Mars signs glow deep crimson, and forms coelesce in front of you. 'Seems they want to test your purity,' she opines cautiously.
Well,' Hama comments. 'A hard-won set of battles, but you finally succeeded in the end. Persistence is also an admirable trait, and merits a reward.'

You climb to the highest point of the Plateau. The view is vast, but your attention is immediately drawn upwards. In the sky, a great ball of fire has come close to Weyard. It dominates the sky. Hama nods. 'Weyard, thankfully, is safe. But this is one of the purest sources of Mars you could hope to meet in your lifetime. Show it your strength, Adept! And beware; Mercury holds no sway here.'

The meteor continues on its way through the sky and beyond, passing Weyard safely. You watch this rare celestial encounter disappear, having taken some of its vast power into yourself during the fight.

Path of Air I.name: Path of Air I
Path of Air I.FlavourText: Jupiter, Wind and Air. Hama will teach you how to master the swiftness, stealth, and knowledge, which make a Jupiter Adept strong.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome, young Jupiter Adept. It has been a while since I have met a child of Anemos. Don't try to think that you will get a lighter treatment, though! Let me show you what it is like to be a Jupiter Adept.

The skill of a Jupiter Adept relies on one thing: Think fast. We need to be one step ahead of our opponent. Just being swifter than someone else is not always enough, we need to *know* what is going to happen.

This swiftness comes at a cost. That is, our lighter setup often costs us some physical prowess and endurance. But we are one with wind. We make our way by flowing around obstacles, squeezing through even the tightest gaps.
Now that I have shown you the strengths of a Jupiter Adept, you need to show me what you've learned. You surely know what to expect.

Marvelous. You have the forces of the wind in your heart indeed. Let me show you how high the wind can take us, across the breadth of Weyard. Prepare yourself first and get stronger, then meet me again.

Path of Air II.name: Path of Air II
Path of Air II.FlavourText: As a Jupiter Adept, you will need to know one of the element's most potent places.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome back! Congratulations, I nearly couldn't hear you approach. Your steps are silent and you are becoming swift like the wind. Come on, take my hand. Let me show you your origins.

The legend of Yegelos and Hoabna is taught as a reminder to keep conflicts between Adepts and non Adepts at bay. We have the responsibility to not repeat the mistakes of the past. Knowledge of your ancestors and history is necessary to achieve that goal.

This place was built a long time ago, by the brothers, sisters, and children of Yegelos, the greatest hero of the Jupiter Clan,' the Jupiter Adept explains with excitement, unusual for the otherwise calm woman. 'Their tribe, the Anemos, left Weyard a long time ago. Legends say, they levitated a piece of this world, which became our moon.'

Ever since this lighthouse was relit, we have seen Weyard change around it. Even before the full unsealing of Alchemy, we saw new Jupiter Adepts gaining power and the climate around us became harsher. Wind may often be still and restrained, but its full power may sneak up on you like a sudden summer storm.

All Jupiter Adepts are said to be descendants of the Anemos. Nobody quite knows if this is true. Yet one thing is certain, the spirit of a glorious huntress of the Anemos lives on in this Lighthouse. Look behind you, do you see the statue of the archer at the smaller aerie? It is made in her likeness. If we are fortunate, we'll be able to meet her.
Do you sense that? She must be close, so be wary... She is a huntress after all, a master of stealth and surprise...

Atalanta puts her bow over her shoulder. She smiles at you invitingly and throws you an impish wink, before she vanishes into thin air. 'Well done! You didn't let her surprise you. You cannot truly know our history without knowing about both sides. We will explore the side of Yegelos' Rival, Hoabna, next. When you have mastered your stealth and swiftness, visit me without me realizing.'

Path of Air III.name: Path of Air III
Path of Air III.FlavourText: Hama teaches you the history more about the history of Anemos, Yegelos and Hoabna.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You see Hama from afar. She doesn't seem to have noticed you yet, so in order to demonstrate your skills, you blow a little whirly tornado in her direction. You notice her lips forming a faint smile. 'Well done, young one. Are you ready to explore the past of Hoabna? Take my hand.'

With a short '*swoosh*' you teleport. You feel some arid heat, not uncomfortable, yet unusual with a constant breeze blowing through your hair. You open your eyes. You're on a mountain top made of orange sandstone. On the floor are red and blue drawings. Far in the skies a gigantic bird is soaring in circles. 'This is the peak of Trial Road, a sacred place to the nearby Shamans.'

The legend of Yegelos and Hoabna tells that the two heroes ran to the top of the road and fought on this very spot. Their mutual respect in doing so and their fame and heroism brought the years-long war between the Shamans and the Anemos to an end.

Mind your step, it's a long way down and enemies like to hide in the ground. Venus is the greatest weakness to us Jupiter Adepts, as these elements are opposites of one another. Yet, without earth we would have nothing to stand on.' You hear a loud screech from the huge bird in the skys. It has lost a lot of elevation and is on a slow descent.

Some people might say 'kill two birds with one stone', but don't be fooled. It will only make the bird more afraid of the stone, yet without the stone the bird would need to fly ceaselessly. It needs the stone to roost and find bugs and seeds in the soil.

You hear the beats of wings, an ear-shattering scream, and feel powerful energy warming your back. You carefully turn around. You stand nose-to-beak with a gigantic bird. It is perfectly white, save a few golden feathers peppered amongst its plumage. It is nearly floating, barely touching the ground. You take a few steps back and ready your weapon.

In the fight, the massive bird lost a single perfect white feather. You pick it up in awe. Procne still has not touched the ground for one moment. She looks deeply into your eyes, and with one loud '***SCREEEEEEEEEE***' the spirit darts off vertically into the skies, where it disappears into the clouds.

Path of Air IV.name: Path of Air IV
Path of Air IV.FlavourText: Hama prepares a traditional Anemos ritual. May your power be strong enough to succeed.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Hama says things, we are in the Anemos Crater

We try to make contact with Anemos. For the ritual we need to put the right totem on the right altar. If you are worthy to the elementals, they might give you a clue. Mind you, they speak in riddles and are quite mischievous.
Four altars
The North Altar. Which idol do you want to put on its pedestal?
The East Altar. Which idol do you want to put on its pedestal?
The South Altar. Which idol do you want to put on its pedestal?
The West Altar. Which idol do you want to put on its pedestal?
Four Elementals
*'Adept of the Wind. Show me your power in a lack of air.'*

RewardTables.message: Path of Air 4 Spoiler for {0}: ||To one of my sides, some creatures dwell. Don't anger me, or storm I'll foretell.||

Matchups.Flavourtext: *'Adept of the Wind. Watch me and follow.'*

RewardTables.message: Path of Air 4 Spoiler for {0}: ||I'm face to face with who helps me fly.||

Matchups.Flavourtext: *'Adept of the Wind. Watch me and follow.'*

RewardTables.message: Path of Air 4 Spoiler for {0}: ||Hear me sing to the moon and the north star will shine.||

Matchups.Flavourtext: *'Adept of the Wind. A strong vortex absorbs the weak.'*

RewardTables.message: Path of Air 4 Spoiler for {0}: ||I'm you, without arms, a thought at best. I see East getting helped by West.||

Matchups.Flavourtext: Prepare Ritual
'What's this? You did not satisfy all the elements?' They appear appalled by your disrespect.
a gust starts. fight the wind, are you stronger than the wind you try to conjure
Kill within 2 turns
Kill within 3 turns
Kill within 4 turns
The storm is enormous, thor appears
Thor
End

Path of Aqua I.name: Path of Aqua I
Path of Aqua I.FlavourText: Mercury, the element of water. Hama will show you how to flow with the streams.

Matchups.Flavourtext: Welcome, Adept. Water flows through your aura like blood through your veins. Let me show you what it is like to be a Mercury Adept. Water is steady as a flowing river. Unlike Jupiter Adepts, Mercury is not rash in the least. Where Jupiter has knowledge, Mercury has wisdom.
Mercury Adepts are masters of healing, unmatched by the less spiritual powers of other elements. Where life is, there is water, and where there is water, life.
Water gets its power from its mass and omnipresence. Go on, flush away your enemies!
You are good! If you think you have what it takes to be a Mercury Adept, show me the power of Water that flows inside of you!

As you can see, the art and power of a Mercury Adept does not lie in its offensive strength. But don't judge wrongly. A Mercury Adept wins through consistency and duration. And in tight situations, the freezing power of ice can cause massive destruction. I am willing to show you more of the secrets and power of Mercury, however first you need to grow stronger. Come back to me, when you are ready.

Path of Aqua II.name: Path of Aqua II
Path of Aqua II.FlavourText: All Mercury Adepts, but especially those close to ice, must be aware of their natural opposite.

Matchups.Flavourtext: 'Greetings, young Adept. I see that your movements are starting to look like the flow of a river. Now is the time to talk about the intricate relations between Mercury and Mars.'
Hama teleports you on a beach, with a gigantic blue mountain a bit further in the land. 'Can you feel this place overflowing with Mercury Psynergy?' Hama asks. You nod.
'That being said, as this place is located in a tropical sea, Mars creatures can also thrive here.'
'A lot can be said about the way Mars and Mercury interract. Water can extinguish a fire, but at the same time, a fire may evaporate water or thaw an ice floe.'

'We cannot easily grasp how Mars and Mercury will behave in the nature. On a battlefield however, what determines which element comes out victorious depends on one thing: The will of their users. Be as impetuous as a torrent!'

'Finally, she appears... Nereid, the daughter of Poseidon. Her looks are not deceiving, she's much more peaceful than her father. She does know how to defend herself if needed though. Today she will simply test you to see if you're worthy of her help, should you need it.'

After the fight is over, Nereid starts giggling. You don't even have the time to feel insulted that you feel like if you were submerged in warm water. 'That looks like a success', Hama remarks. Nereid then puts her fan in front of her face while her turtle swims away, carrying her on its back.
'As usual, I'll send you back to where we came from. Train hard once again, and come back when your practice paid off. The next time, we're gonna try to meet one of the most impressive beings of the seven seas.'

Path of Aqua III.name: Path of Aqua III
Path of Aqua III.FlavourText: Find out about the past of Mercury Adepts, by joining Hama in the middle of the big blue ocean.

Matchups.Flavourtext: You find yourself on a strange ship, with a dragon head on the prow. You see Hama on the bow, looking ahead. 'This is one of a number of ships people from a civilization known as Lemuria used. They, like yourself, were Mercury Adepts, and very proficient ones at that. These are some of the waters they've explored ages ago. Rather dangerous ones, I might add, but today they will serve as your lesson.'

Perhaps you're wondering where exactly on the ocean we are? We're on the Great Eastern Sea, not too far off from the Sea of Time and Lemuria itself. Lemurians had quite the time exploring these waters eons ago, as the Sea of Time is a cruel part of the Great Eastern Sea. They say numerous ships have gone down both entering and leaving Lemuria. Fortunately for us, we won't need to navigate it today.'

Lemuria wasn't the only civilization to send out explorers, numerous others did the same. There was conflict to be had over domain of territories both on ocean and on land. Some struggles even resulted in wars, though we are fortunate enough to live in an age where such struggles are long since past.'

Some of these struggles were held on land itself, clashing blades and pitting armies against those that challenged them. Other battles were held on the oceans, where navies sought reign over the waters near the land they coveted; cannonballs were exchanged between sides, ships would close in on others to send in their best warriors in hopes of slaying the enemy crews. It is truly a violent past to behold, one that shouldn't be overlooked.'

Many explorers in the past have witnessed some of the frightful creatures the oceans have to offer. Before you is one of the mightiest, the Kraken. It is a powerful beast, with a reputation to sink ships with little trouble. Part of your test today requires you to fell one yourself.'

You begin to see bubbles ahead of the ship, a bit off the starboard side. These bubbles turn into ripples, then waves. A massive whale breaches the surface, splashing seawater everywhere. Hama seems unphased, and she simply smiles. 'Adept, say hello to Neptune, the guardian of Weyard's Oceans. You will be facing him in battle today as a test of your power.'

Hama, still standing on the bow while watching ahead, smiles. 'You've passed your lesson here today, and proven quite strong as a Mercury Adept. Very well done. I hope you're prepared to face bitter, harsh cold for your final trial...'

Path of Aqua IV.name: Path of Aqua IV
Path of Aqua IV.FlavourText: Hama put out an urgent call for your help. Will you answer?

Matchups.Flavourtext: Hama nods to you as you arrive. 'Good, you're here. We don't have much time. A massive ice storm has formed near Tundaria. It's rushing north and growing in size and power. It will flood and freeze all of Weyard, starting with Mikasalla, unless it is stopped.' She holds out her hand. You take it, and are abruptly somewhere much colder... Shivering, Hama wishes you luck, to not get lost and tells you she'll return for you. Then she is gone.

You step out into Tundaria. The roaring winds of the ice storm scream around you, blinding you and making it hard to see the way ahead. In the wake of the storm, trees and shrubs have been frozen solid. The greenery shall be the l*e*ast of your concerns... Which direction should you go?
No, this can't be the right way. Something tells you that the right direction is hidden in plain sight...
Trusting in your Psynergy to protect you, you approach the storm. Some wolves emerge from the howling blizzard and attack!
Pressing onward into the storm, it becomes harder to see through the unorthodox weather. Where should you go?
A flight of dragons wings in from above and decides you look like easy prey.
You head on, but almost step into an enormous cleft in the ice. You'll have to find another way.
Through the howling wind, you hear laughter and shouts. You head towards them, and find oceanic nobility enjoying the storm. They immediately take exception to your intrusion.

After the fight, the Mermen tell you that in Lord Boreas' absence, the lords of ice and water have decided to make themselves known to the world in their rawest form. You will need to find Boreas and bring this to a halt!
You quickly find a trio of grudge-holding Krakens barring your path, something tells you that you must be close.
The chill is really starting to get to you. What a weird path you took. Oh, what would you give for a hot cup of tea. You *must* be nearly to the center of the storm now.
Curiosity got the best of you! In the middle of the circular path you took, something glimmers through the blizzard.

You reach the center of the storm, and a host of icy and watery creatures cavorts to raucous music: monstrous throats singing, frozen trees shattering, and crude drums pounding. You fight your way into the middle of the commotion.

What is this?' bellows a loud voice. You turn, and a burly merman with a crown and a vicious trident shoulders his way forward to face you. 'A human dares to interrupt our revelry? In the name of our missing Lord Boreas, have at thee!'

The storm begins to die down as Poseidon is defeated. However before you can relax, the ground begins to shake, icy ground splitting open beneath the partygoers and you. Boreas rises up. You pause to heal up, trusting the Lord of Ice and Snow will hear you out. Alas, he sees Poseidon and the other fallen members of his court, and spares you no time to explain.

Having defeated Boreas, you explain the situation to him. He apologizes for the misunderstanding, and tells you he was attacked by a powerful dark shadow. He fought off the entity, but was gravely wounded and unable to rule his subjects. With a gesture from his hand, the creatures of ice and water disperse, ending the powerful ice storm. 'Thou has proven thyself a master of Mercury, young Adept. Call upon me when thy need is great, and I will freeze thine enemies solid.' You look upon the devastation wrought across Tundaria by the storm, and know you have gained a powerful ally.

Gusts of blinding snow whoosh and spin you around. You've lost track of where you were, and can't seem to find the path forward. Faintly, in your mind, you can hear Hama's voice. 'I am here, Adept. I can take you back to where you started. Do you wish to start anew, or head home for now?'

RewardTables.message: Never give up...

Matchups.Flavourtext: Chilled to the bone and exhausted, you turn away from the massive, frozen vortex. Maybe you can return another day, before the storm does irreparable damage to Weyard...

Forest Den.name: Forest Den
Forest Den.FlavourText: The creatue hid in a small den, you need to challenge it before it cuts down the trees and threatens the serenity of Kolima.

Matchups.Flavourtext: 'You humans. Don't you see that the world is better off without your meddling? Let nature and alchemy run wild! This world belongs to the beasts and animals, there is no place for you!'
The beast charges at you. Watch out!

'You... you defeated me. You are no normal human. You are stronger than I expected! As if you controlled the psynergy... but that's impossible! Humans bent on destroying the world, killing every beast in their paths. But you, if you can tame the powers of Alchemy, I want to trust you... for now.'

Snowy Cavern.name: Snowy Cavern
Snowy Cavern.FlavourText: A snow covered cavern serves as the hideout for a certain creature...

Matchups.Flavourtext: 'Ice... good... Ice... preserve... Ice everywhere... means peace', the beast murmurs in a rumbly, deep voice.
The monster takes a big breath through its nostrils, opens its mouth and an onrush of cold air and snow blows into your face.
The beast is defeated. 'Ice... cold... Human.. strong... Gib... bellyrub... pls'

Bloomy Glade.name: Bloomy Glade
Bloomy Glade.FlavourText: In the middle of Mogall Forest, a small glade is filled with an aromatic breeze...

Matchups.Flavourtext: 'Who... who are you? How did you find me, how did you find me in this hidden forest? Are you an elf? Oh, an Adept? A human with the power of Psynergy? No, that can't be... it's nature, us, the kingdom of plants who must spread over Weyard again. Beasts took our place and ate our fruits, then humans came and trampled our saplings. NO! It must stop. I must rid the world of those who harm plants and blow everything not rooted to the ground off the world!'
Flora makes gestures with her hands. You feel vines grasping and wrapping around your legs as the breeze emanating from the spirit picks up.

'You stood your ground... and you showed strength greater than that of a usual human... it must be from the psynergy inside of you. Plants must be protected and have a fair place in this world. Nature must be preserved. Take this task upon yourself, and I will lend my strength to you!'

Megaeras Challenge.name: Megaeras Challenge
Megaeras Challenge.FlavourText: Megaera invites you to battle her. If you win her respect, she might tell you what is going on.

Matchups.Flavourtext: So you came. The spirits are restless, as you may have noticed. It has been eons since this much energy has been available to us. But before I tell you more, show me your power.'
Megaera grabs the two massive swords that are floating by her side. Try your best!

Indeed, you are strong. I feel like I can trust you. The spirits are trying to claim the energy set free by the unleashing of Alchemy for themselves. You may have met some of them already, but believe me when I say that a lot more powerful ones are out there. My task is to protect the human race. The lighthouses you humans created are nearly unlimited sources of energies and the spirits may be attracted to them. I am enroute to Venus Lighthouse. Will you help me prevent the worst?'

The Way Southwards.name: The Way Southwards
The Way Southwards.FlavourText: On the horizon you can make out the black-red storm clouds, that blackened the sky above you earlier. Is this where your path will lead you next? Please stay patient until this chapter becomes available!

Matchups.Flavourtext: You shouldn't be here.

Halloween Special.name: Halloween Special
Halloween Special.FlavourText: Happy Halloween! A twisted forest, with unknown dangers. Dare you enter?

Matchups.Flavourtext: You find yourself in a graveyard surrounded by unfamiliar trees... The air is deadly silent and chill. As you try to orient yourself, hands sprout from the grave sites beneath you!
Having returned the corpses to their rest, you look around and realize you are quite lost. You pick a direction and start moving into the forest... but several of the trees start moving towards you!

Stepping over the splinters of the mobile trees, you continue through the forest hoping to find a way out, or a safe place to rest. The woods get darker and darker, and more unearthly sounds assault your ears...
Before you can catch your breath, ghosts swirl around you, leaving you dizzy.

You spot a glow between the trees, and head towards it. A giant pumpkin, lit from the inside, leers at you toothily. You go to look inside... out flies an agitated Mars Djinni! While you're still processing that, the pumpkin sprouts insectoid legs and a stinger and tries to bite!

The pumpkin shatters, revealing some loot. You collect it quickly, but before you can try to convince the Mars Djinni to join you, it zooms away! Hoping it might know the way out, you follow the light it sheds, and come face-to-face with its friends.

Howls begin behind you. The baying of hounds chasing their prey. Instinctively, you know who they're hunting: you. You take off running, trying to find any place to hide, but to no avail... after several pulse-pounding minutes, the Wild Hunt has found you. The hounds go for your throat.

Breathing hard, you pause for a moment by a pair of massive, gnarled oak trees. There seems to be no way out of this forest, and you're tired from fighting for your life. So naturally, the oaks begin to move, opening two brilliant red glowing eyes each, and taking swipes at you.

As the hellish light fades from the massive tree's eyes, your vision suddenly becomes blurry and everything fades to black. You slowly regain consciousness where you last remember being, but your exhaustion and heavier gold pouch tells you this was no dream.

A Very Golden Christmas.name: A Very Golden Christmas
A Very Golden Christmas.FlavourText:
A wintertime celebration in a far away land. Join the festivities!
(Event dungeon, available until <t:1641510000>)

Matchups.Flavourtext: Hama finds you on your travels and smiles. 'Adept, it is time to take a break from your adventures. There is a festival I think you'll like, far to the north.' She teleports you somewhere else... and a couple feet directly above a snowdrift. You promptly fall in with a FLUMF!

As you climb out of the snow pile and Hama finishes chuckling, she explains, 'Prox, the home of the fallen heroes Saturos and Menardi, lies just to the north. Their yearly celebration of the winter solstace has begun. See you there!' She waves and vanishes. Where she stood, a small box lies. You pick it up and begin your trek north. A few wild creatures spot you on the way.

Approaching the village of Prox in the frozen north, you see it is brightly lit. You get closer and notice thousands of candles, braziers, and colored lights made of Psynergy! As you stare at the beautiful sight, a few more monsters notice you.

You enter the legendary home of the Proxians. Scaly-skinned people mingle and laugh in its streets, exchanging gifts and buying small sweets and baked goods. A street performance catches your eye. Puppets, enhanced by Psynergy lights and sound effects carouse across a wooden theater. They reenact the lighting of the Mars Lighthouse, the noble act that brought the world back into balance and saved Prox itself from destruction.

After the show, a puppeteer stands up. He is tall and pony-tailed, with dark brown hair and compelling eyes. He appears to not be from Prox, given the lack of scales in his skin. He nods to you and walks away. Curious, you follow him up some stairs and into the night. Several twists and turns later, you find him at the highest house in the village. Several Djinn keep him company here. Seeing you, they ask for a friendly battle.

After the spar, the Adept bids you goodbye and motions you back across a snow-covered bridge over a frozen river. A couple excited, giggling children run past you toward an open area to the north. You follow them.

A white-bearded, elderly man dressed all in red sits here in front of a fir tree. Like the puppeteer, his face is also not scaly. He seems to be talking at length to a group of children and their parents. By and large, people are politely feigning interest, but every now and then he calls out a child's name and hands them a box or bag wrapped with a bow. Squeals of glee greet each gift. 

Upon spotting you, the man addresses you, 'Well! It's been a while! It's good to see that more Adepts are exploring the world... back when Jenna and I were stuck on Idejima... the restoration of Alchemy... Lemuria...' He natters on for at least 15 minutes, getting further and further off-topic. Eventually you find yourself yawning, and he notices. 'Well! How rude! Perhaps a fight will wake you up!' He jumps to his feet and attacks!

'Have you no respect for the elderly?'. The man settles back into his chair after you defeat him. 'Hmph! You seem more awake, at least. But I only give presents to good children! Bad children meet my friend! I found him deep in a cave... the depths of a massive desert... great battle...' Ignoring the renewed ramblings, a massive, winged, curly-horned, red-skinned demon appears behind the red-clad man. As the parents usher their children back, the demon trots towards you on enormous cloven hooves. Each footstep shakes the ground, and he brings his hammer to bear.

Defeated, the demonic creature nods and lowers his hammer. In a booming voice, he announces, 'Well fought, Adept.' He reaches behind him and brings out a box from somewhere, handing it to you. Then he vanishes, and cheers ring out from around you. The festivities continue, and you spend the rest of the night feasting and celebrating with the Proxians. Stuffed with good food, you find your way to the inn, where a warm bed awaits you, free of charge this festival night.
E
Again?
End
